intro: Strobilanthes bolumpattiana, commonly known as the Bolumpatti strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy bracts that resemble flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its flowering period is seasonal, often occurring during the rainy season, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinators. Due to its unique appearance and habitat preferences, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
